Issues.Title: Use List<T> instead of ICollection in BehaviorDataObject
Issues.Body:
Finish work started in #8673 
Related: #8140

Now that `DropSourceBehavior` is passed a `List<IComponent>` in its constructor, we can update `BehaviorDataObject` to do the same instead of using `ICollection`

## Proposed changes

- Refactor `BehaviorDataObject.DragComponents` to be a `List<IComponent>` and update code accordingly
- Another small `BehaviorDataObject` refacto while we're touching this code, but in a separate commit


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10278)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use List<T> instead of ICollection in BehaviorDataObject" (#10278)

Issues.Title: Dataset Designer Partial Class Files Reformatted on Visual Edits
Issues.Body:
### Environment

.NET 8 Visual Studio Dataset Designer

### .NET version

8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Yes, back before VS 2017 I think.

### Issue description

User code in partial class files for Datasets gets reformatted when a visual edit is made using the Dataset designer. Partial class files are not designer files and so should not be getting reformatted.

### Steps to reproduce

Create a Dataset using the Dataset Designer.
Add a DataTable.
Create a partial class file for the dataset.
Format some code in the partial class.
Make a visual change to the DataTable.
Source in partial class will be reformatted.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dataset Designer Partial Class Files Reformatted on Visual Edits" (#10275)

Issues.Title: Add a project for testing trimming
Issues.Body:
Adds a simple sample project for testing trimming. It has a TextBox, SplitContainer, Button, and ComboBox. It accepts text drops into the TextBox and uses the ClipBoard class to copy text out of the ComboBox.

This is meant to be a starting point to assess and fix the most important warnings / issues with trimming.

@vitek-karas, @LakshanF, @sbomer, @agocke 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10274)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add a project for testing trimming" (#10274)

Issues.Title: Add IAccessible dispatch support
Issues.Body:
Adds IAccessible dispatch support through AccessibleDispatch.

AccessibleObject has the requisite interfaces defined. IAccessible is currently just stubbed out (all return E_NOTIMPL). When IAccessible is implemented and `IManagedWrapper` is added to AccessibleObject, it will get IDispatch support.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10267)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add IAccessible dispatch support" (#10267)

Issues.Body:
MicrosoftNETTestSdkVersion holds reference to NewtonsoftJsonVersion 9.0.1 which is out of compliance.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10266)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/6.0] Upgrade MicrosoftNETTestSdkVersion" (#10266)

Issues.Title: Use ITypeInfo directly in StandardDispatch
Issues.Body:
CreateStdDispatch doesn't do anything other than pass through to ITypeInfo so we'll do the same directly and save some of the overhead and make the code clearer.

To avoid loading and unloading the ITypeLib repeatedly we'll simply keep it alive (via the ITypeInfo) once we've loaded it once. We can expect that in an app that uses these we'll continue to need them throughout the lifetime of the app.

This allows removing the IWrapperInitialize interface, which further simplifies the way things work. I'll follow up with a change that simplifies our ComWrappers a bit based on this.

Issues.Title: Replace more ArgumentOutOfRangeException with custom messages
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #9726
Follow-up to #9755

## Proposed changes

- Takes care of leftovers from #9755
- Remove some low added value custom error messages, each in its own commit

Issues.Title: The parent window of a frame should same with the original window of the web browser
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-alpha.1.23558.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it cannot repro in .NET /6.0/7.0/8.0.

### Issue description

Automation case about XHtmlWindow met an error "FAIL: equality between windows failed" when testing HtmlWindow's op_Equality, get_Frames methods.
We created a test sample in .NET 9, got following result:
**Actual result:**
Shows "Not expected!" message. The "htmlWindow.Frames[0].Parent.Document.Window" not consistent with "webBrowser1.Document.Window".

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/8783ddb8-56ab-4cae-9978-07bb6153309a


**Expected result:**
Shows "Expected!" message. The "htmlWindow.Frames[0].Parent.Document.Window" should be consistent with "webBrowser1.Document.Window".

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/4fe74015-b350-4846-99a8-d9ea909d018e


### Steps to reproduce

1. Download and extract project: [XHtmlWindow failed.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13306587/XHtmlWindow.failed.zip)
2. Build and run
3. Click button1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The parent window of a frame should same with the original window of the web browser" (#10261)

Issues.Title: Replace ArrayList with List<T> in TableLayoutPanelBehavior
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #8140

I fixed the field name in the same PR (in a separate commit) to make it easier to review all the call sites of this field


## Proposed changes

- Replace `ArrayList` `styles` with `List<TableLayoutStyle>` `_styles` in TableLayoutPanelBehavior

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator cannot focus on and announce the list items when pressing up/down keyboard for ListView/ListBox/CheckListBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-alpha.1.23558.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It's a regression issue, doesn't repro on .NET 8.0/7.0/6.0.

### Issue description

Narrator cannot focus on and announce the list items when pressing up/down keyboard for ListView/ListBox/CheckListBox.

**The behavior for .NET 9.0:**
![9 0](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/62929087/4d70623b-6503-48bb-91d6-e2f6ff479540)
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/62929087/9432a837-3e89-4405-9c1d-670baeb188af)

**The behavior for .NET 8.0:**
![8 0](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/62929087/03f0f719-4c25-480f-8c4d-5722ec12d07f)


### Steps to reproduce
[WinFormsApp134.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13304574/WinFormsApp134.zip)

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core application with ListView control.
2. Add some columns and Items for it.
3. Set ListView's View as Details.
4. Build and run the application.
5. Launch the Narrator tool, try to focus on the first item of ListView.
6. Press up/down keyboard to focus on the next item.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator cannot focus on and announce the list items when pressing up/down keyboard for ListView/ListBox/CheckListBox" (#10259)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading when detecting listBox control with scrollbar
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.23558.10

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It's a regression issue. Not repro on .NET 8.0/7.0/6.0.

### Issue description

Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading and does not display test results.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/e54014b2-8d7e-45b7-a50e-66abc009a750

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/bb9349e7-cfa2-4be5-b929-0bb0aa7e3c26)




### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core application with ListBox control.
2. Add multiple Items to the ListBox and make sure it has scrollbars.
3. Build and run the application.
4. Open the Accessibility Insights tool, Select the ListBox and click Test Element.

**More Info:**
1. This issue is also reproduced in the CheckListBox control.
2. This issue is not reproduced in the ComboBox and TreeView controls.
3. **This issue is only reproduced when the control has a scrollbar.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Accessibility Insights tool keeps loading when detecting listBox control with scrollbar" (#10258)

Issues.Title: ValuePattern.Value property changed event is not sent from TextBox control.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0 RC2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 7.0.13

### Issue description

When listening to UIA events from the TextBox control, only text changed event is sent in .NET 8. However, there is also value property changed event in .NET 7.

.NET 7
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/85718983/6fbb2ba7-083a-4185-8662-a411fe9d2fcd

.NET 8
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/85718983/fd75b565-f281-4a48-aa00-1fe1ac568c22

This may be caused by this PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7741 that implements the UIA provider for TextBox.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Insert a TextBox control to a Form.
2. Run the application.
3. Open Accessibility Insights for Windows and listen to UIA events of the TextBox.
4. Input characters in the TextBox and observe the events.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ValuePattern.Value property changed event is not sent from TextBox control." (#10257)

Issues.Body:
This automation capability has been deprecated, and even though it was configured it has not been used or working.
